messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Genetics means the study of how living things get their body parts from their parents.  
A mutation means a change in a gene. Genes are parts inside our body that help decide how we look and grow.  
DNA is a long code inside our body. It has all the information to make us who we are.

People want to know if genetics help us have the ability to speak. Some researchers found a gene change a long time ago. This was between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago. This change may help us speak and control our mouth and face. Monkeys have a gene like ours. But their gene did not change like ours.  

It is too early to say how much genetics help us with speaking. But one day, we may find the answers in our DNA.
